text: - Shiv Sehgal.

I'm the EVP of Audience
Analytics at RSG Media.
Generative AI is impacting the media
and entertainment industry in many ways.

I first want to say it's
first on data democratization

and dissemination of information
across the enterprise.
That's always been important,
but especially in today's day and age,
the ability to tell that research story,

automate certain processes
to collect the data,

present it in a way that's
very easy to understand,

that's, you know, one of the
biggest ways generative AI
has been impacting the media
and entertainment industry today.

The biggest misconception
about generative AI

is that it's a magic wand that
could do kind of anything.
It's very important to understand
what is the business problem

and tie the right technology
to that business problem.

We have clients who are
expecting generative AI

to, number one, build
descriptive insights.

That's very much possible,
but we still recommend
to develop your own forecasting models,
develop your own optimization models,
and sometimes have GenAI speak to your AI.

It's just understanding
where to put the right pieces
of the puzzle together.
Balancing security, model reliability,
and getting the information that you need,

balancing all three of those
components at the same time

is something that everyone
needs to be mindful of.
I will say that working with AWS,

having all of those different
pieces of the puzzle
come together within the AWS tech stack,
and that's one of the best, you know,
advantages of working with the AWS
team, platform, and people,

is that we have all of those
components there for us.

AWS can support us in many
ways in our GenAI journey.
I think, first, it just comes
to having people to speak with.
It really starts with that, you know,

person to person, that
personal connection.
AWS helps our company
deliver powerful solutions to our clients.
Everything from data orchestration,

data management, the ability
to compute information,

having all of that secure,
